intro: Strychnos phaeotricha, commonly known as the yellow-leaf strychnos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Loganiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often yellowish-green in color. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, woody pods containing seeds. Strychnos phaeotricha is typically found in moist, forested areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
